Package Datastructures.Theory.EquivalenceClasses

Class EquivalenceClasses

java.lang.Object
Datastructures.Theory.EquivalenceClasses.EquivalenceClasses
public class EquivalenceClasses extends Object
This class manages lists of equivalence classes of literals. It operates in two modes:
Initial phase: analysis of the input clauses.
Search phase: parallel to the solvers, as thread.
Initial phase:
It is called after the unit clauses are put into the model. The input ist: 1. the model with the initial unit clauses.
2. the basic equivalence clauses one by one.
The literals in the equivalence clauses are analysed and new equivalence classes are generated. New unit clauses are put into the model.
Search phase as thread:
It gets its input from the model and from the TwoLiteral module.
Equivalences are stored as clauses with sorted literals The first literal (with the smallest predicate) is the representative of the equivalence class.
The representative is always positive.

    • queue

      private final PriorityBlockingQueue<Datastructures.Task<EquivalenceClasses.TaskType>> queue
      A queue of newly derived unit literals and binary equivalences. The unit literals are automatically put at the beginning of the queue.

      private final ArrayList<Utilities.TriConsumer<Integer,Integer,InferenceSteps.InferenceStep>> observers
      These observers are called for new equivalences: (representative,literal,inferenceStep) They are not called for the EQUIV inputClauses.

    • integrateEQUIVClauses

      public void integrateEQUIVClauses(ArrayList<int[]> equivalences) throws Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable
      turns all equivalences from the input clauses into EquivalenceClass objects.
      Parameters:
      equivalences - the equivalence classes from the input clauses
      Throws:
      Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable - if a contradiction is discovered.

    • addObserver

      public void addObserver(Utilities.TriConsumer<Integer,Integer,InferenceSteps.InferenceStep> observer)
      Any solver which is interested to know about newly derived equivalences can add an observer. The observer is called with (representative, literal, inferenceStep) as soon as new equivalences representative == literal are derived.
      Parameters:
      observer - a TriConsumer for transferring newly derived equivalences.

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts the instance in a thread. The thread waits for newly derived unit clauses (via the model) and newly derived equivalences and integrates them into the equivalence classes. During this process, new unit clauses and new equivalences may be derived. The unit clauses are transferred to the model, and the equivalences are made available by the equivalenceObservers.
      The loop can only be stopped by an interrupt or a contradiction.
      The result is stored into the variable result.

    • getRepresentative

      public int getRepresentative(int literal)
      finds the representative for the class containing the literal.
      Parameters:
      literal - a literal
      Returns:
      0 or the representative for the literal

      inferenceStep - which caused the truth

    • integrateEquivalence

      public void integrateEquivalence(int literal1, int literal2, InferenceSteps.InferenceStep inferenceStep)
      This method is to be called to announce a newly derived equivalence literal1 = literal2. The equivalence is put into the queue.
      Parameters:
      literal1 - a literal.
      literal2 - an equivalent literal.
      inferenceStep - which caused the equivalence.

    • addEquivalence

      protected void addEquivalence(int literal1, int literal2, InferenceSteps.InferenceStep inferenceStep) throws Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable
      integrates a clause into the equivalence classes. Literals are replaced by representatives of other equivalence classes (if necessary)
      True and false literals cause all equivalent literals to become true/false
      Double literals are removed.
      Complementary literals cause Unsatisfiable to be thrown.
      Overlapping equivalences are joined to the new clause (the clauses are removed).
      All observers are applied to derived clauses.
      Parameters:
      literal1 - a literal
      literal2 - a literal with literal1 = literal2
      inferenceStep - which caused the equivalence
      Throws:
      Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable

    • applyTrueLiteral

      protected void applyTrueLiteral(int literal, InferenceSteps.InferenceStep inferenceStep) throws Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable
      A true literal causes all other equivalent literals to become true.
      Parameters:
      literal - a true literal
      Throws:
      Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable - if a contradiction occurs.

    • completeModel

      public void completeModel() throws Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable
      If a literal in an equivalence class is true, then all other literals are also made true This method is called when a partial model is found, which is supposed to be extendable to a complete model.
      Throws:
      Datastructures.Results.Unsatisfiable - if the resulting model becomes inconsistent (should never happen)

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      checks if there is no equivalence class
      Returns:
      true if there is no equivalence class

    • toString

      public String toString()
      turns the equivalence classes into a string "representative = literal1 = literal2 = ... [origins]". No symboltable is used.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the equivalence classes.

      Returns:
